member.name: T:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray
member.summary: MWArray is an abstract class that serves as the root of the MATLAB array class hierarchy. It encapsulates a native MATLAB mxArray and provides a managed API for accessing, formatting, and manipulating the native array.
member.Remarks: MWArray and its derived types support the ICloneable, ISerializable, and IDisposable interfaces. They provide implicit conversion to and from native .NET types to the appropriate MATLAB array type. They also provide type specific indexing based on the indexing available for the corresponding MATLAB array type.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.DisposeArray(System.Object)
member.summary: This dispose method recursively frees the resources of the MWArray instances contained in the Object argument.
member.remarks: If the object implements the IDisposable interface, it is freed by calling its Dispose method. If the object represents an array of objects that implement the IDisposable interface, each object in the array is freed via the dispose method. Finally, if the object represents a multi-dimensional array, the array is recursively processed to free each object contained in the array.
member.param: The object to dispose

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.Dispose
member.summary: Releases resources of the MWArray and the native mxArray that it encapsulates.
member.remarks: This method allows for the explicit lifecycle control of an MWArray and its native MATLAB array.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.ToArray
member.summary: Returns a native .NET array containing a copy of data in the underlying MATLAB array.
member.remarks: The returned array has the same dimensionality as the underlying MATLAB array. The elements of the returned array are converted according to default conversion rules. If the underlying MATLAB array is a complex numeric type, toArray throws an exception. If the underlying array is sparse, a full representation of the array is returned. Care should be taken when calling toArray on a sparse array with large row and column dimensions, as this action may exhaust system memory. If the underlying array is a cell or struct array, toArray is recursively called on each cell.
member.returns: A native .NET array with the same dimensionality as the original MWArray

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.NetDimensionToMATLABDimension(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Helper method to change dimension ordering from .Net to MATLAB In .Net dimensions grow to the left, i.e the outermost dimension is the highest dimension. In MATLAB the dimension grows to the right, i.e the innermost dimension is the highest one. For example page(n) X .. X page(1) X row X col in .Net becomes row X col X page(1) X ..X page(n) in MATLAB
member.param: dimensions ordered according to .Net
member.returns: dimensions ordered according to MATLAB

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.MATLABDimensionToNetDimension(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Helper method to change dimension ordering from MATLAB to .Net In .Net dimensions grow to the left, i.e the outermost dimension is the highest dimension. In MATLAB the dimension grows to the right, i.e the innermost dimension is the highest one. For example page(n) X .. X page(1) X row X col in .Net becomes row X col X page(1) X ..X page(n) in MATLAB
member.param: dimensions ordered according to MATLAB
member.returns: dimensions ordered according to .Net

member.name: P:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.Item(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Generic MATLAB array indexer returning the result as an MWArray
member.remarks:
An index can be any number of integers corresponding to the array's dimensions. As with MATLAB, a single index will return the nth element in the array.
NOTE: The generic array indexer supports numeric, logical, char, and cell array types. For complex numeric arrays, both the real and the imaginary components are returned. ARRAY INDEXING IN THIS API, AS IN MATLAB, IS ONE BASED RATHER THAN ZERO BASED
member.param: Array of integers corresponding to an array subscript

member.name: P:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWArray.NativeGCEnabled
member.summary: Static property representing the native array GC enabled flag.
member.remarks: If the native array GC is enabled, a CLR garbage collection will take place transparently as required to remove instances of the MWArray class or one of its derived types that are no longer being referenced. This includes unmanaged memory allocated through explicit creation of MWArray types, as well as implicit instantiation of an MWArray via an implicit cast.

member.name: T:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Utility.NativeGCAttribute
member.summary: The NativeGCAttribute class defines a custom assembly attribute that keeps track of the native heap allocations for instances of the MWArray classes. When the specified or default memory allocation has been reached, the appropriate add/remove memory pressure method is called.
member.remarks: The use of this attribute is optional, however, if it is defined it must be specified on the main assembly. If not specified, the default behavior is to enable the GC trigger with a block size of 1 Meg byte.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Utility.NativeGCAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)

member.param: Enable flag for automated garbage collection of mxArray native heap allocations.

The number of megabytes of native heap allocated to mxArrays that will result in a call to the add/remove memory pressure methods

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Utility.MWMCR.InitializeApplication(System.String[])
member.summary: This method initializes the first instantiation of the MATLAB Runtime with the user specified set of startup options.
member.remarks:
This method is used to override the MATLAB Runtime global default startup options. It is optional and MUST only be called once before any other MATLAB Runtime instance is initialized.
Note: The startup options passed to this method apply to all subsequent instances of the MATLAB Runtime and cannot be changed by them.
member.param: A string array of MATLAB Runtime startup options.
member.returns: Returns the MATLAB Runtime application initialization status.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Utility.MWMCR.TerminateApplication
member.summary: This method terminates an MATLAB Runtime application.
member.remarks: No MATLAB Runtime instance or method should be accessed in any way after calling this method.
member.returns: true for success.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Utility.MWMCR.TerminateApplicationEx
member.summary: The TerminateApplication() method listed above does not actually terminate the application since the assembly is built with NOT_INHIBIT_SHUTDOWN undefined. This method is needed to prevent an application from crashing caused by the delayed MATLAB Runtime termination in the GC finalizer thread if a message is to display by the MATLAB Runtime during the showdown (see g1025721 for detail).
member.remarks: No MATLAB Runtime instance or method should be accessed in any way after calling this method.
member.returns: true for success.

member.name: T:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray
member.summary: MWNumericArray is the managed representation of the MATLAB numeric array types. Like its MATLAB equivalent, it is the default array type used by most of the MATLAB math functions.
member.remarks:
As MWNumericArray is derived from MWIndexArray it can be used in all MATLAB indexing operations.
See NUMERIC ARRAY in the MATLAB documentation for a full description of this array type.

member.param: A byte scalar value

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n double array from a native vector of byte values in row major order.
member.remarks: A double numeric array is created that can be used in the double array computations supported by MATLAB. To create a true uint8 array, or to use a data vector in column major order use the constructor: MWNumericArray(int rows, int columns, byte[] realData, bool makeDouble, bool rowMajorData).
member.param: The number of rows in the array
The number of columns in the array
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the real data in row major order.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n uint8 array from a native vector of byte values.
member.remarks: Setting the makeDouble flag to true will create a double array. Setting the rowMajorData flag to false allows a data vector in column major order to be passed to this constructor.
member.param: The number of rows in the array
The number of columns in the array
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the real data.
Double array flag
A flag indicating that the data vector is in row major order

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n complex double array from a real and imaginary vector of byte values in row major order.
member.remarks:
A complex double numeric array is created that can be used in the double array computations supported by MATLAB. To create a true complex uint8 array, or to use a data vector in column major order use the constructor: MWNumericArray(int rows, int columns, byte[] realData, byte[] imaginaryData, bool makeDouble, bool rowMajorData).
The size and row order of the real data vector must match that of the imaginary data vector.
member.param: The number of rows in the array
The number of columns in the array
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the real data in row major order.
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the imaginary data in row major order.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.remarks:

The size and row order of the real data vector must match that of the imaginary data vector.
member.param: The number of rows in the array
The number of columns in the array
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the real data.
A byte array of length [rows x columns] containing the imaginary data.
Complex double array flag
A flag indicating that the data vectors are in row major order

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Array)
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n-by-p-by-... real double numeric array from a native rectangular array in row major order. The numeric array will have the same shape as the user specified data array. If the input array is a jagged array then creates an m-by-n-by-p-by-... numeric array of the same type as the element type of the jagged array.Throws if the jagged array does not have a rectangular shape.
member.remarks:
A real double numeric array is created that can be used in the double array computations supported by MATLAB. To create a specific array type from a rectangular array, or to use a data array in column major order use the constructor: MWNumericArray(Array realData, bool makeDouble, bool rowMajorData). Valid types are byte, short, int, long, float, or double.
NOTE: As MATLAB arrays must have at least two dimensions, single dimension data vectors will result in the creation of a two dimensional array with a single row.
member.param: A native array containng the real data.

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Array,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n-by-p-by-... real numeric array from a native array in row major order. The numeric array will have the same shape as the user specified data array.
member.remarks:
Setting the makeDouble flag to true will create a double array regardless of the type of the native data array. Setting the rowMajorData flag to false, allows a data vector in column major order to be passed to this constructor. Valid data types are byte, short, int, long, float, or double. Jagged arrays are not allowed.
NOTE: As MATLAB arrays must have at least two dimensions, single dimension data vectors will result in the creation of a two dimensional array with a single row.
member.param: A native array containing the real data.
Double array flag
A flag indicating that the data vector is in row major order

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.#ctor(System.Array,System.Array)
member.summary: Creates an m-by-n-by-p-by-... complex numeric array from a real and imaginary native array in row major order. The numeric array will have the same shape as the user specified data arrays.
member.remarks:
A complex double numeric array is created that can be used in the double array computations supported by MATLAB. To create a complex array of a specific type, or to use data arrays in column major order use the constructor: MWNumericArray(Array realData, Array imaginaryData, bool makeDouble, bool rowMajorData).
NOTE: Valid data arrays are non-jagged arrays of type byte, short, int, long, float, or double. The imaginary data array can be null, but if not, its size, row order, and type must match the real data array.
member.param: A native array containing the real data.
A native array containing the imaginary data.

Setting the rowMajorData flag to false, allows a data vector in column major order to be passed to this constructor. Valid data types are byte, short, int, long, float, or double. Jagged arrays are not allowed.
NOTE: As MATLAB arrays must have at least two dimensions, single dimension data vectors will result in the creation of a two dimensional array with a single row.
member.param: A native array containing the real data.
A native array containing the imaginary data.
Double array flag
A flag indicating that the data vector is in row major order

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.ToArray
member.summary: Returns a native array containing a copy of the underlying MATLAB data.
member.remarks: This method returns a copy of the array component in row major order. The dimensions of the MATLAB Array are maintained. The type of the array elements is determined by the data type of the numeric array. If the MATLAB Array is a complex data type, this method will throw an InvalidDataException.
member.returns: A native array corresponding to the underlying MATLAB Array

member.returns: A native array containing the requested component of the numeric array

member.name: M:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.MWNumericArray.BuildNumericArray(System.Array,System.Array,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Internal utility routine that returns a MATLAB mxArray for which the type, dimensions, and data are defined by a native array of real and imaginary values.
member.remarks: Valid data arrays are non-jagged arrays. of type byte, short, int, long, float, or double. The returned MATLAB array will be of type double regardless of the element type of the native array. The imaginary data array can be null, but if present, its size and type must match the real data array. If required, this method will optionally convert the data arrays to double and/or column major arrays.
member.param: An array that contains the real data.
An array that contains the imaginary data.
Create a MATLAB double array
A boolean flag indicating whether the data array is in column or row major order

member.name: T:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.native.MWArray
member.summary: MWArray is an abstract class that serves as the root of the MATLAB array class hierarchy. It encapsulates a native MATLAB mxArray and provides a managed API for accessing, formatting, and manipulating the native array.
member.Remarks: MWArray and its derived types support the ICloneable, ISerializable, and IDisposable interfaces. They provide implicit conversion to and from native .NET types to the appropriate MATLAB array type. They also provide type specific indexing based on the indexing available for the corresponding MATLAB array type.

member.summary: Generic MATLAB array indexer returning the result as an MWArray
member.remarks:
An index can be any number of integers corresponding to the array's dimensions. As with MATLAB, a single index will return the nth element in the array.
NOTE: The generic array indexer supports numeric, logical, char, and cell array types. For complex numeric arrays, both the real and the imaginary components are returned. ARRAY INDEXING IN THIS API, AS IN MATLAB, IS ONE BASED RATHER THAN ZERO BASED
member.param: Array of integers corresponding to an array subscript

member.name: P:MathWorks.MATLAB.NET.Arrays.native.MWStructArray.Item(System.String)
